3/4

Address: 1140 S University Ave, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Basic, counter-serve spot with late-night hours, serving burritos, tacos & quesadillas.

summary.snippet: "Friendly service, tasty food, awesome location, and it has a super cool vibe."
"Small place, but big burritos, great flavor, very friendly staff"
"They're open late, have low prices, and serve huge servings of delicious food."

most_relevant.description: My go-to burrito spot!  The tastiest and biggest, doesn't seem physically possible to pack that much in, but they do.  A longtime local spot with a great location too!

The service was excellent. Even a lady that worked there left her great smelling fragrance on the bag. Then the packaging was more secure than Amazon packages. Revealing a huge medley of delicious ingredients true to the BTB A2 tradition. Keep up the good work! ✌️

EDIT: restaurant reached out and should be offering tap water upon request. Current stars reflect this stated policy along with the delicious food.

I will amend this review accordingly if the policy changes. I've been a fan and advocate for the shredded chicken deluxe burrito since the Big Ten days. How disappointing to find that BTB won't provide tap water to paying customers (should be free to anyone that asks). The State/Packard location always had cups available. The cashier at Cantina was great, no fault to them, but the policy is inexcusable.

Had been craving a burrito and decided to give BTB a try and was not disappointed. I got a steak burrito with guac and medium salsa which ended up being a little pricey at $13 but it was so good. My only issue is that they have no seating so I had to walk all the way back to my dorm in order to eat. I will definitely be coming back with my friends whether it’s for lunch or a midnight snack.

Came to Ann Arbor from out of town with my fiancée and needed a quick bite to eat late at night. I was floored when we opened the bag of food when we got home. Some of the best Mexican food I have ever had in my life. Definitely worth the stop by and I know I’ll be craving this for a long time.
My wife and I ordered grilled chicken quesdila and the chicken were very dry. It wasn't that good but chips n salsa were good.
We tried the California burrito and chicken quesadilla. Both were great portion sizes and tasty. I love that this spot on campus is affordable and good.
Had the fire and ice burrito. The steak was super tasty. Decent sized burrito in general. Def would order again.
